page.title: 14FARMING, RAGDALE AREA _ 2
page.content:
There is Dairy farming in the area around the village of Ragdale in north_east Leicestershire. There is one large herd of pedigree Charolais cows in Ragdale and several smaller herds of Friesian cows on nearby farms.
There are herds of beast on some farms.
Several flocks of sheep are kept on the rough grazing.
There are some ten farms in the area around Ragdale. Farming is mixed. Some of the pasture has remained uncultivated for hundreds of years and evidence of medieval farming practices can be seen in the land ridges.
